complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the Lesson Studio Implementation into granular subtasks covering: (1) Rich-text/block editor foundation, (2) AI-powered content generation, (3) Media asset management and AI media generation, (4) Accessibility output generation, (5) Version history and comparison, (6) Export functionality (PDF, DOCX, slides), (7) API and RLS enforcement, (8) Collaborative editing and real-time updates.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: This task encompasses a full-featured lesson creation suite with advanced AI, rich media, accessibility, export, and collaboration features. It requires deep integration across frontend, backend, AI services, and accessibility, making it highly complex and necessitating further breakdown for effective execution.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Expand the Assessment Builder and Feedback Engine into subtasks for: (1) Assessment UI and question management, (2) AI-powered quiz generation, (3) Rubric and grading system, (4) Plagiarism/integrity checking, (5) Personalized feedback generation, (6) API and RLS enforcement, (7) Analytics and reporting.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: This task involves complex UI, AI-driven question and feedback generation, automated and manual grading, integrity checking, and analytics, all requiring robust backend and frontend coordination. The breadth and depth of features demand further decomposition.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Decompose Study Space Core Implementation into subtasks for: (1) UI core components, (2) Knowledge-base chat, (3) Smart note-taking, (4) Mind-map generator, (5) Audio podcast creator, (6) Collaborative features, (7) API and RLS enforcement.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: This task integrates multiple advanced features (chat, mind-mapping, podcasting, smart notes, collaboration) into a unified suite, each with significant technical and UX complexity, warranting detailed subtasking.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Expand Teacher Tools Implementation into subtasks for: (1) UI framework and navigation, (2) Tool-specific input forms and workflows, (3) API endpoints for each tool, (4) Job processing and progress tracking, (5) Output storage and export, (6) Tool usage analytics and history.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: While the tools are modular, implementing 10 distinct AI-powered generators with real-time job tracking, storage, and export introduces considerable complexity, especially in workflow and integration.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down Mastery Tracking and Competency System into subtasks for: (1) Dashboard and visualization components, (2) Micro-credentials and badge issuance, (3) Predictive analytics and at-risk alerts, (4) API and RLS enforcement, (5) Integration with recommendation engine, (6) Data model and standards mapping.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: This task combines real-time data visualization, predictive analytics, credentialing, and standards mapping, each requiring specialized logic and integration, making it moderately high in complexity.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Expand Gradebook and Analytics Implementation into subtasks for: (1) Gradebook UI and data grid, (2) Competency heatmaps, (3) Bulk feedback and override, (4) Data management and calculations, (5) Analytics dashboards, (6) SIS/ePortfolio integration, (7) API and RLS enforcement.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: This task involves real-time data grids, analytics, complex calculations, integrations with SIS/ePortfolio, and advanced feedback mechanisms, all of which are technically demanding and interdependent.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Decompose Personalization and Adaptive Learning into subtasks for: (1) Adaptive learning engine, (2) Goal-driven pathway system, (3) Personalized dashboards, (4) Remediation/enrichment generation, (5) Continuous adaptation logic, (6) API and RLS enforcement, (7) Integration with mastery and course designer systems.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Adaptive learning requires sophisticated algorithms, real-time data analysis, personalized content delivery, and deep integration with other systems, making it highly complex and in need of granular subtasks.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Expand Interoperability and Standards Compliance into subtasks for: (1) LTI 1.3 Tool Provider support, (2) OneRoster API, (3) SCORM export, (4) Caliper Analytics, (5) AI Skills Marketplace architecture, (6) API documentation and developer guides.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Supporting multiple edtech standards and building a secure plugin marketplace involves protocol compliance, security, and integration challenges, requiring careful modularization.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down Security, Governance, and Compliance into subtasks for: (1) Tenant isolation and RLS, (2) Audit logging, (3) Compliance workflows (FERPA, GDPR, COPPA), (4) Data residency controls, (5) Security dashboard, (6) Data export/deletion, (7) SOC 2/OWASP controls, (8) Privacy policy and reporting.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: This task covers foundational security, multi-tenant architecture, regulatory compliance, auditability, and privacy, all of which are critical and complex, demanding extensive subtasking.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Expand Performance Optimization and Deployment into subtasks for: (1) Frontend performance (code splitting, image optimization), (2) Backend optimization (queries, caching), (3) SSR/SSG strategies, (4) CI/CD pipeline setup, (5) Monitoring and observability, (6) Scaling and rollback planning.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Optimizing for high performance and scalability across frontend, backend, deployment, and monitoring is multifaceted, involving both infrastructure and application-level improvements.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Decompose Testing, Documentation, and Launch Preparation into subtasks for: (1) Comprehensive testing suite (unit, integration, e2e, a11y, visual), (2) User and admin documentation, (3) Training and onboarding materials, (4) Support systems and feedback channels, (5) Launch communications and analytics setup.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: While broad, this task is more process-oriented and less technically deep than others, but still requires careful planning and execution across multiple domains.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down Course Player UI into subtasks for: (1) Layout and sidebar navigation, (2) Content viewer with rich media, (3) Assessment integration, (4) Progress tracking, (5) Adaptive features, (6) Accessibility compliance, (7) State management and persistence.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: This task requires building a highly interactive, accessible, and adaptive UI that integrates lessons, assessments, progress, and personalization, each with significant technical and UX complexity.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Implement Document Upload and Listing for Base Classes
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Expand Document Upload and Listing into subtasks for: (1) Database schema changes, (2) Backend API development, (3) Frontend upload and listing UI, (4) Knowledgebase integration and indexing.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: This is a well-scoped feature with clear backend, frontend, and integration requirements. While not trivial, it is less complex than the large-scale systems above and can be managed with a moderate number of subtasks.
